data.title: implement pythonic len()
data.body:
len() in python is a simple builtin utility to count the number of items in a tuple,list,dictionary and then simply return the results. something like this:

func len(list):
    var x = 0
    for i in list:
        x+=1
    return x

Maybe I'm the only one, but I tend to implement something similar quite often in my scripts.

data.title: Ability to rename root node of inherited scene
data.body:
It would be really nice if there could be ability to rename the most root node in inherited scene. 
Reasoning:
Currently when we are inheriting a scene, the base name for this scene is taken from it's ancestor and there is no possibility to change it in the scene itself. So for example when we are creating concrete enemies, we have a lot of "BaseEnemy"  names and we need to remember to rename them manually each time after instancing this concrete scene somewhere, which is inconvenient and error prone.

data.title: Fix ios libpng link error
data.body:
Maybe this fix #3120
There is a commented line for neon_enabled in platform/iphone/detect.py, why? I suppose uncomment it and add -mfpu=neon and **ARM_NEON** needed to activate neon optimization on ios.

data.title: If marking text in script-editor while scrolling down/up with mousewheel, it stops marking text
data.body:
Whenever i want to mark a lot of code while scrolling up/down with mousewheel, it stops marking the code. 
I know, it itsn't a real bug, but for me, it would be more comfortable to work if i could mark code this way.

data.title: Windows compile error (drivers/libdrivers)
data.body:
(win7 x64, MinGW w64)
When trying to compile latest source I get errors like this:

```
drivers\libdrivers.windows.opt.tools.32.a(pem_lib.windows.opt.tools.32.o):pem_lib.c:(.text+0x18c7): undefined reference to `BUF_MEM_grow'
drivers\libdrivers.windows.opt.tools.32.a(bands.windows.opt.tools.32.o):bands.c:(.text+0x18f4): undefined reference to `renormalise_vector'
```

More errors: http://pastebin.com/t49bhY5s

I tried to find commit which makes this problem, so I started to compile different versions. So far:
Not working: [2478c](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/tree/534c8e74b9e4990ac1f63ef701330552cecfc28f)
Working: [2418c](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/tree/a028840ea5cfc6ac4e80d99c4850ae3f10eeb353)

So my guess is [this commit](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/commit/0f57bbb8e97b3eba84e5453a5d1948d699a67515), but can't verify this atm., maybe tomorrow

data.title: FileSystem tab don't show empty folders

data.title: .travis.yml upgrade
data.body:
Now it test 6 builds:
- Ubuntu 14.04 -  x11 (g++)
- Ubuntu 14.04  - x11 (clang++)
- Ubuntu 14.04 - windows (via MinGW)
- OS X - osx (g++)
- OS X - osx (clang++)
- OS X - android
- OS X - iphone

Instead of just g++ on Ubuntu 12.04...

data.title: Camera2D margins don't consider calculations for rotated or zoomed camera
data.body:
This is related to #1912 
The camera2D does not consider the rotation when checking the margins.

Here's a test project: https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/274954519/godot-issues/camera-bug.zip
Move the camera using the arrow keys and the R key for rotation.
When the scale is not 1, 1 the margins dont work. The same happens when the rotation is different than 0.

data.title: Fix libpng link errors on android
Building x11 tools fails on current master
data.body:
As of current master (commit 020700af1d664c7b6e3b8b8d50a23e86286ef3dd) I get an error when trying to build godot. scons p=x11 gives the error:

```
platform/x11/joystick_linux.cpp:36:44: fatal error: libevdev-1.0/libevdev/libevdev.h: No such file or directory
compilation terminated.
```

git blame points to commit af633c794179d29a4bf0c01983c8b08d14553596 so most probably that's the faulty commit.

Note that I couldn't find version 1 of the evdev headers for my distro (kubuntu 15.10), only version 2.

data.title: Warn when using / instead of res:// while loading stuff
data.body: The above situation will lead to behavior that's different between the version launched by the editor and the version that is exported by the editor.

data.title: GUI support for multilinguar texts in RichTextLabel (new property for translation keys)
data.body:
As the title says, when you want to add keys that are put in a translation file in a richtextlabel, you have to do it through code, since the UI just prints the text. The code looks like this:

extends RichTextLabel
func _ready():
        #set_text doesn't exists for richtext, so let's use add_text
    get_node(".").add_text(tr("EXPZ_DESC_00"))
    pass

But when rendered on screen it acts like this: http://www.gyazo.govanify.com/grab/0246fb.png
It can be seen clearly that BBCode isn't parsed, while enabled in the projects and font setted up.

On a side note you also have to set up the size of the text in a richtext label, unlike a normal label, which you don't specially know when translating stuff,

data.title: Ask before making shared resources like animations or collision shapes
data.body:
Silently making resources like animations, collision shapes shared among scenes can be very ugly and time consuming to fix. It can mess up a large portion of the project.

Example 1: I build many levels. Each new level I copy from another, existing one because they are complex and it would be unnecessary work to build each level from the ground up.
All collision shapes are now shared among all levels and if one is changed, they all change and mess up the levels.

Example 2: Same as nr. 1, but with powerups or enemies. Very easy to make that mistake and mess up all the enemies without noticing it.

Example 3: Making animations for enemies. When saving a copy of an enemy to create the next one. Adjust the frames on the animation (spritesheet) and now all the enemies made before have messed up animations.

TLDR: Sharing these resources during copy should be a special function and not the default. In most cases you want unique resources.

data.title: Crash on newly cloned git version of Godot
data.body:
To test out Godot for the first time, I created a new project, placed some 2D nodes, and wrote a player script.
Having one Node2D, with a player script and the default texture for the sprite worked fine, I could run around.
When I set the scene up so that there was a root node, with two child nodes, one being the previous player and the new one being a copy, without the player script (I did this to test raycasting), it crashes every time.
I'm on Ubuntu 15 64bit

This is my script

```
extends Node2D

var velocity
var acceleration
var top_speed
var mass
var g_acc
var friction_co

func _ready():
    set_process(true)
    velocity = Vector2(0,0)
    acceleration = 1000
    top_speed = 560
    mass = 80
    g_acc = 9.82
func _process(dt):
    var horizontal = 0
    if (Input.is_action_pressed("move_right")):
        horizontal += 1
    if (Input.is_action_pressed("move_left")):
        horizontal -= 1
    if (horizontal == 0):
        friction_co = 1.2
    else:
        friction_co = 0.18
    var current_position = get_pos()
    var new_position = current_position
    var prev_velocity = velocity
    velocity.x += horizontal * acceleration * dt
    var vel_mag = velocity.length()
    if (vel_mag > top_speed):
        velocity = prev_velocity
    var direction = velocity.normalized()
    var surf_norm = Vector2(0, -1)
    var gravity_dir = Vector2(0, 1)
    var gravity = gravity_dir * mass * g_acc * dt
    var space_state = get_world_2d().get_direct_space_state()
    var ray_result = space_state.intersect_ray(current_position, new_position)
    if (not ray_result.empty()):
        velocity = Vector2(0,0)
    else:
        var friction = -direction * friction_co * gravity.y
        velocity += friction
        new_position += velocity * dt
        set_pos(new_position)
```

This was the terminal output

```
OPENING: /home/ian/workspace/godot_test (::home::ian::workspace::godot_test)
freed code id 1
ian@tux-station:~/source/godot/bin$ VBoxContainer: 136,100

   At: tools/editor/editor_data.cpp:598.

data.title: Mipmap not working in editor
data.body:
This is a bug that changes the image to a black rectangle when using mipmaps.

How to reproduce:
1 Change the theme of a button or panel and use a StyleBoxTexture with the image.
2 Uncheck all the image flags.
3 Save the scene and close Godot.
4 Open Godot and navigate to the scene again.
5 Now add the mipmaps flag to the image. The image now is all black.

data.title: Better gamepad support
data.body:
This is an updated and fixed up version of my original PR #2796

It should now build properly on all platforms and I also fixed most of the remaining bugs.
There's only a minor problem left, but as I [discussed](https://github.com/Hinsbart/godot/pull/8#issuecomment-165582019) with punto recently, it's not really a dealbreaker.
I'll open an issue about that, so we can figure this out.

Also, I tried to adress the problem of tabs vs spaces, and now it's certainly cleaner. The only space indentation left is in the new files, joystick & joystick_linux, and a bit of input_default... It's really tiresome to do this manually, any tips?

data.title: OSX build on Linux failed with "no matching function for call to 'pthread_setname_np' "
data.body:
I'm building on ubuntu 64 14.04 on digital ocean.

All of my osx builds failed with the error:

```
[03:07:01][Step 21/28] drivers/unix/thread_posix.cpp:84:12: error: no matching function for call to 'pthread_setname_np'
[03:07:01][Step 21/28]         int err = pthread_setname_np(pthread, p_name.utf8().get_data());
[03:07:01][Step 21/28]                   ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
[03:07:01][Step 21/28] /root/osxcross/target/bin/../SDK/MacOSX10.10.sdk/usr/include/pthread.h:475:5: note: candidate function not viable: requires 1 argument, but 2 were provided
[03:07:01][Step 21/28] int     pthread_setname_np(const char*);
[03:07:01][Step 21/28]         ^
[03:07:01][Step 21/28] 1 error generated.
[03:07:01][Step 21/28] scons: *** [drivers/unix/thread_posix.osx.debug.64.o] Error 1
```

Yesterday it built just fine.

```

[20:40:56]Step 2/28: Clear Windows 32 Theora (Command Line) (2m:39s)

data.title: pthread build error on ios/osx
data.body:
It seems the function pthread_setname_np has to be called differently on different platforms:

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/2369738/can-i-set-the-name-of-a-thread-in-pthreads-linux/7989973#7989973

On OSX and (presumably) iOS, you have to call it with just the name, from within the running thread.

data.title: theora uses inline assembly, can not build godot with msvc 2013 without theora=no
data.body:
**Bugsquad note:** _There seems to be a confusion of which Visual Studio prompt to use when compiling the engine. The documentation needs to be more explicit about this subject._

my env:

Intel Q6600 msvc 2013 ... windows 7 sp1 x64

As the title states, theora uses inline assembly, so scons + msvc 2013 x64 fails with: 

drivers\theora\cpu.c(59) : error C4235: nonstandard extension used : '_asm' keyword not supported on this architecture

I read on the net that msvc x64 doesn't support inline assembly... that would probably be the reason.

But, 32 bit also fails with theora in even though supposedly __asm is supported in it (not sure why, but it does)...

So, as far as i can tell, this isn't an issue with my compiler/computer, as I can build without theora x64 or x86... What i mean is, the issue is with every msvc (2013, and previous, and maybe 2015) compiler probably...

So, the compiling godot for windows tutorial on the wiki now (probably) won't work for anybody using msvc on x64... because of theora? Am i correct?

scons p=windows   //fails, above error (this should be x64 on my x64win, maybe i'm wrong?)
scons p=windows theora=no //successfull build
scons p=windows bits=32 //fails (not sure why, supposedly _asm is supported in 32bit but maybe not?)
scons p=windows bits=32 theora=no // build succeeds

data.title: Png transparency converted to black
data.body:
Some times when using images that contains an alpha channel, the alpha is discarded and rendered as black in the editor. 
What's confusing is that after launching the application the image with the black alpha is written to disk overwritten the original texture, what makes it very annoying.

[This is the original image](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/274954519/godot-issues/button_focus.png)
![button_focus](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6296184/11882961/784a16a2-a4ee-11e5-8a29-18ecbb8e9cc7.png)

[And this what godot overwrites after using it in-editor](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/274954519/godot-issues/button_focus_after.png)
![button_focus_after](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6296184/11882977/8b6ca4c0-a4ee-11e5-81be-f74575454732.png)

This is a very annoying issue as it appears to be random, and even after reimporting the issue can be retriggered.
Even using the import feature does not fix the black background.

Is this related to #1178 ?
